description:
On this first meetup meeting, I want to explain the ideas of Peer-to-Peer, Collaborative and Sharing Economy based on the ideas of great temporay thinkers on transformational economy like Charles Eisenstein (http://charleseisenstein.net/) , Michel Bauwens (http://p2pfoundation.net/Michel_Bauwens) , Prof. Liebaer (http://www.lietaer.com/) and Michel de Kemmeter (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YpBNv9Ec8ig)

After the presentation I have the pleasure to invite you to share your ideas about common core values the group should have to be succesful. This core values will be translated in a Manifesto. 

Hope to see you !
name: Kick-off meeting Business721

description:
Hello ,

I am very pleased to annouce an exciting meetup next sunday from 2 members of the Business721 collaborative economy group : Michel De Kemmeter and Alain Minnoy

Michel De Kemmeter is the inventor of the "Resources Systemics" approach, a new systemic economy model as an answer for failing debt-based growth and neoliberal capitalistic economies.

It is based on 3 principles:


(1) Every project, company or organisation should contribute to common good.


(2) Every company, person, team, city authority or other stakeholder has assets and liabilities on 7 levels (earth, material, processes, emotional, communication, knowledge, common good)


(3) Every project should add value on different levels in its stakeholders ecosystem


Alain Minnoy is a super ayurvedic cook and modern time yogi promoting sharing and love as the greatest values we can use to make the world a better placeto live at.

Hereby all the info concerning the meeting Sunday :


(GB) A new way to understand business for a new economyby Michel De

You’re a manager and you want to set new goals for your company? You’re a contractor and you want to be part of the solution? You want to change your lifestyle and find a job closer to your true expectations?

Speaker: Michel de Kemmeter

Who is Michel :

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michel_de_Kemmeter

Price: 15€ (one drink included, no cocktails or spirits) Food : ayurvedic food cold buffet at a reasonable price, 2.5€ / tapas.

The place : The Magic Mirrors, 200m from the Atomium. Avenue de l'Atomium, right after the ‘Salon 58’ restaurant on your right.

This Sunday event at Magic Mirrors could also be the perfect occasion to discover or rediscover the wonderful Heysel Parc.

Final booking by phone or email only:
Stijn De Witte [masked]
[masked]

Inscriptions can be done on the following link :

http://www.meetup.com/Vidya-Ayurveda-Brus…/events/[masked]/

Cheers,

see you sunday ?
